revised_title: Investigating the Synthesis of Fats in the Intestinal Mucosa
tldr: The author investigates the synthesis of fats in the intestinal mucosa and mesenteric lymphatic vessels during fat absorption. The study finds that the synthesis of neutral fat occurs in the intestinal villi before the lymph reaches the mesenteric lacteals, and that pancreatic extracts have a marked ability to release fatty acids from soap.
